introduction: Welcome back to Coding with Qiskit, where we learn how to build quantum algorithms using the open-source SDK for programming quantum computers with Python. In this episode, we'll be installing Qiskit locally and using a specific circuit library to create our first quantum algorithm.

sections.title: Section 1: Installing Qiskit Locally
content: Setting up a Python environment using Anaconda for easier package management.
Importing necessary libraries for the algorithm.
Defining input data and output for the algorithm.

sections.title: Section 2: Fourier Checking Circuit
content: Introduction to the Fourier checking circuit from the signal processing domain.
Using the circuit for calculating correlations between Fourier transforms of input functions.
Visualizing the results using a histogram.

sections.title: Section 3: Running the Algorithm
content: Executing the circuit on a quantum simulator or real quantum backend.
Interpreting the output probabilities and their significance.
Exploring the impact of input functions on the output probabilities.

sections.title: Section 4: Summary and Next Steps
content: Recap of the installation process, algorithm, and execution.
Discussion on the importance of quantum algorithms for specific tasks.
Preparing for more advanced quantum algorithms in future episodes.

sections.title: Section 5: Qiskit Resources
content: Exploring Qiskit documentation, tutorials, and community resources.
Further learning opportunities for quantum computing and programming.
Engaging with the Qiskit community for support and collaboration.
